title: Council Decision of 23 October 2001 appointing members and alternate members of the Advisory Committee on Education and Training in the Field of Architecture
header:
Council Decision
of 23 October 2001
appointing members and alternate members of the Advisory Committee on Education and Training in the Field of Architecture
(2001/C 320/02)
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN UNION
recitals:
,
Having regard to Council Decision 85/385/EEC of 10 June 1985 setting up an Advisory Committee on Education and Training in the Field of Architecture(1), and in particular Articles 3 and 4 thereof,
Having regard to the Act of Accession of 1994, and in particular Article 165(1) thereof,
Whereas, according to Article 3 of the above Decision, the Committee consists of three experts from each Member State and one alternate for each of those experts; whereas, according to Article 4 of the same Decision, the term of office of these experts and alternates is three years.
Whereas by its Decision of 26 February 1996(2) the Council appointed the members and alternate members of the Committee for the period 26 February 1996 to 25 February 1999.
Whereas the Governments of thirteen Member States have each submitted a list of candidates with a view to the appointment, replacement or renewal of the term of office of members and alternate members,
main_body:
The following are hereby appointed members and alternate members of the Advisory Committee on Education and Training in the Field of Architecture for the period 23 October 2001 to 22 October 2004:
A. Experts from the practising profession
>TABLE>
B. Experts from universities or equivalent teaching institutions in the field of architecture
>TABLE>
C. Experts from the competent authorities of the Member States
>TABLE>
attachments:
Done at Luxembourg, 23 October 2001.
For the Council
The President
A. Neyts-Uttebroeck
(1) OJ L 223, 21.8.1985, p. 26.
(2) OJ C 74, 14.3.1996, p. 1.
